prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "EmployeeID": ["E001", "E002", "E003", "E004", "E005", "E006", "E007", "E008"],
    "Department": ["Sales", "HR", "Tech", "Sales", "Tech", "HR", "Tech", "Sales"],
    "PerformanceScore": [4, 3, 5, 2, 4, 3, 5, 4],
    "YearsExperience": [5, 2, 8, 3, 6, 2, 10, 4],
    "ProjectsCompleted": [10, 5, 15, 4, 12, 6, 20, 8],
    "TrainingHours": [20, 40, 10, 50, 20, 30, 15, 25]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Print the shape of the DataFrame. 2) List the data types of each column. Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, print its shape, and list the data types of all columns.
